title: How to Shop on Amazon When You Use Apple Pay: Alternatives

steps.title: If you're shopping on Amazon.com or using the Amazon mobile app, you cannot pay with Apple Pay.
steps.content: If you're shopping on Amazon.com or using the Amazon mobile app, you cannot pay with Apple Pay. You can, however, use your Apple Card to make Amazon purchases, just as you would any other credit card.

steps.title: Even though Amazon doesn't accept Apple Pay, there are plenty of payment options available.
steps.content: Even though Amazon doesn't accept Apple Pay, there are plenty of payment options available. FSA and HSA cards Venmo – A particularly good option and alternative to Apple Pay if you don't want to provide your credit or bank account card information to Amazon. Credit cards Debit cards Personal checking accounts EBT cards

steps.title: You can use Apple Pay when shopping in store at Whole Foods.
steps.content: You can use Apple Pay when shopping in store at Whole Foods. Whole Foods, which is owned by Amazon, does accept Apple Pay. [1] X Research source Because this Amazon-owned company does have support for Apple Pay, there's a chance Amazon may accept Apple Pay for purchases in the future.

steps.title: Some vendors that use Amazon Payment Services to process payments accept Apple Pay.
steps.content: Some vendors that use Amazon Payment Services to process payments accept Apple Pay. This means that if you're shopping online on a website (that isn't Amazon) that uses Amazon's payment solution to process digital payments, you'll often see the option to check out with Apple Pay. [2] X Research source This does not mean that Amazon accepts Apple Pay—only retailers who use Amazon's payment processor for selling items on other websites.

steps.title: Open the Amazon Mobile app.
steps.content: Open the Amazon Mobile app. If you want to pay for Amazon purchases with your Apple Card, you can add the card to your Amazon wallet and select it as your payment method during checkout. Tap the app icon that looks like the side of a box with the Amazon smile on it. Apple Card is a free-free credit card offered by Apple that integrates well with Apple Wallet. If you don't have an Apple Card, you can apply for one if you have an Apple Pay-eligible device, along with other qualifications you can find at the Apple Site .

steps.title: Tap your account icon.
steps.content: Tap your account icon. This looks like an outline of a person at the bottom of your screen.

steps.title: Tap Your Account.
steps.content: Tap Your Account . It's a tile near the top of your screen.

steps.title: Scroll down and tap Your Payments.
steps.content: Scroll down and tap Your Payments . Scroll down until you find the "Payments" header. Your Payments is the first listed item there.

steps.title: Tap + Add next to "Cards & accounts."
steps.content: Tap + Add next to "Cards & accounts." You'll see this near the top of the Wallet tab that's open by default.

steps.title: Tap Add a credit or debit card.
steps.content: Tap Add a credit or debit card .

steps.title: Enter your Apple Card information.
steps.content: Enter your Apple Card information. If you don't know your Apple Card's information, open the Wallet app on your iPhone, tap the Apple Card, then tap the card number icon (it's in the upper right corner). [3] X Research source If you want to use this card for every purchase, tap the box to check it next to "Set as default payment method."

steps.title: Tap Save.
steps.content: Tap Save . You'll see a confirmation that your card information has been saved and added to your Wallet. Next time you make a purchase from Amazon, you can select your Apple Card in "Payment information" (you can skip this if you set your Apple Card to your default payment method).
